item.title: St. Augustine Ghost Tour: A Ghostly Encounter
item.description: Ideal for families, this ghost tour of St. Augustine’s spookiest sites combines light-hearted fun with spine-tingling tales of the city’s past. Alongside a costumed guide, you visit cemeteries, the ground of the Old Fort, and other haunted locations to discover the little-known legends that surround the romantic venue. This small-group tour is limited in order to maintain an atmosphere suitable for the ghost walk.

image.alt: St. Augustine Ghost Tour: A Ghostly Encounter

item.title: Medieval Torture Museum with Ghost Hunting and Tiny Art Gallery
item.description: Visit the Medieval Torture Museum and get the Ghost Hunting Experience and Tiny Art Gallery Admission with all inclusive package. You can enjoy all three activities at one visit.

image.alt: Medieval Torture Museum with Ghost Hunting and Tiny Art Gallery

item.title: Private Guided Historic Electric Cart Tour of St. Augustine
item.description: The coastal town of St Augustine is renowned as the oldest European settlement in the United States. On this private tour, benefit from the undivided attention of your guide and enjoy a tour itinerary tailored to your group’s interests. Traveling by electric vehicle, visit areas normally only accessible on foot, stop at historic landmarks and churches, and hop off to take photos.

image.alt: Private Guided Historic Electric Cart Tour of St. Augustine

item.title: Sunset Cruise of St. Augustine
item.description: See St. Augustine from a new perspective with this leisurely sunset cruise. Climb aboard a boat for a scenic cruise including views of Castillo de San Marcos National Monument, the Bridge of Lions, and the St. Augustine Lighthouse. Sip beer or wine from the on-board bar with the Osprey, 21 and older option, or select the Island Breeze option for a family-friendly experience.

image.alt: Sunset Cruise of St. Augustine

item.title: St. Augustine's Wine, Cocktail and Food Experience
item.description: Want to eat out during your trip to St. Augustine, but not sure where to go? Get acquainted with the city’s wine and food scene during this St. Augustine Food, Wine, and Cocktail Tour. Go to some of the most unique spots in the city to grab a bite and an alcoholic beverage in the afternoon, one of the best times to explore, with a guide who knows the city’s history well.

image.alt: St. Augustine's Wine, Cocktail and Food Experience

item.title: Walking History Tour of St. Augustine's Historic District
item.description: History buffs will love this unique historical walking tour through St. Augustine’s historic district. Your guide will cover the history of the city from its founding all the way up through the early 1900s. The tour covers nearly two-miles of ground, taking you from the Castillo de San Marcos National Monument to Flagler College and the Tolomato Cemetery. Bring comfortable shoes, bottled water, and a thirst for knowledge.

image.alt: Walking History Tour of St. Augustine's Historic District

item.title: Dolphin, Manatee and SeaTurtle SUP Adventure Tour of St Augustine
item.description: Get close to the unique wildlife living just off the shores of St. Augustine during this on-water adventure tour. Choose between a kayak or a paddle board, slip on a life vest, and head out onto the water with a guide. As you paddle around the St. Augustine Lighthouse and Anastasia State Park, you may encounter dolphins, sea turtles, and the West Indian manatee.

image.alt: Dolphin, Manatee and SeaTurtle SUP Adventure Tour of St Augustine

item.title: Airboat Adventure in Saint Augustine with a Guide
item.description: Explore the freshwater tributaries along the scenic St. Johns River on a thrilling airboat ride that skims through a maze of shallow waterways. Watch for alligators, manatees, birds, and snakes as you speed through the watery Florida landscape, and learn the story of an infamous pirate ship that sank in the St. Johns River. This St. Johns River airboat tour includes personal headsets, so you won't miss a word of the captain's fun and informative commentary.

image.alt: Airboat Adventure in Saint Augustine with a Guide

item.title: Old Jail Museum Tour in St. Augustine
item.description: Once a holding site for St. Augustine’s hardest criminals, the Old Jail Museum now offers visitors an educational look at life in the Nation’s Oldest City. Tour a maximum security area and regular cells alike that held prisoners until 1953, learning about fascinating historical accounts of criminal lives in St. Augustine as you go.

image.alt: Old Jail Museum Tour in St. Augustine

item.title: Dolphin and Wildlife Adventure of St. Augustine
item.description: This relaxing cruise is great for nature lovers, families, or those who simply enjoy being out on the water. Cruise the Intracoastal Waterway—an inland waterway that runs parallel to the coastline—for a calm ride exploring St. Augustine’s estuaries. Keep your eyes peeled for marine life such as dolphins, manatees, sea turtles, pelicans, osprey, and spoonbill. Along the way, you’ll spot landmarks including the Bridge of Lions, Castillo de San Marcos, St. Augustine Lighthouse, and more.

image.alt: Dolphin and Wildlife Adventure of St. Augustine

item.title: Corks & Forks Tour (St. Augustine)
item.description: If you’ve got an appetite for experiencing the best food and wine St. Augustine has to offer, then grab a bib and a comfortable pair of walking shoes for this unique foodie tour. Corks and Forks is a food and wine pairing tour that’ll introduce you to the tasty side of America’s Oldest City. Sample local cuisine and delicious wine while strolling through the Historic District.

image.alt: Corks & Forks Tour (St. Augustine)

item.title: 8pm Beyond the Grave Tour
item.description: If you're into all things creepy and spooky, this 'beyond the grave' tour of St. Augustine is ideal for you. You'll be taken to a number of locations of interest to the Savannah Ghost Research Society. These include cemeteries and buildings where ghosts have been sighted and paranormal activity recorded. Your guide will dig beneath the urban legends in an attempt to uncover the true stories that lie within.

image.alt: 8pm Beyond the Grave Tour

item.title: Nights of Lights Boat Cruise
item.description: Celebrate the holidays in St. Augustine with a nighttime boat cruise. Choose between two different vessels – one for adults only with an on-board bar, the other family-friendly and BYOB – and set on a scenic cruise to see the millions of white lights that make up the Nights of Lights Festival. Experience the magical atmosphere of the twinkling lights on the water.

image.alt: Nights of Lights Boat Cruise

item.title: Wine Tasting Cruise in St. Augustine
item.description: Sail along St. Augustine’s picturesque coastline—and indulge in a number of generous wine samples—during this two-in-one tour. Make your own way to the dock, hop aboard the pontoon boat, and get comfortable: as you set off, you’ll see landmarks like the Castillo de San Marcos, the Bridge of Lions, and more. You’ll also taste six different wines, and will have access to the on-board bar.

image.alt: Wine Tasting Cruise in St. Augustine

item.title: Ghost Tour of St. Augustine: The Original Haunted History Tour
item.description: Many ghost tours add a lot of maybe-it-could-have-happened kind of talk, but this St. Augustine Haunted History Ghost Tour is led by a straight-shooting paranormal investigator. You’ll visit spooky sites in the city like Huguenot Cemetery, Tolomato Cemetery, and St. George Street, and hear about true tales from St. Augustine’s haunted past. Plus, your guide teaches you about devices, methods, and techniques used in paranormal investigation.

image.alt: Ghost Tour of St. Augustine: The Original Haunted History Tour

item.title: Feast of Saint Augustine Historical Walking Food Tour
item.description: Knowing where to grab food and wine in a new city takes a lot of time and effort researching. Skip the nitty gritty details of studying online reviews and take this St. Augustine Food Walking Tour instead. This tour takes you to many local restaurants, eateries, and even a wine store to learn about the city’s food culture and history—while enjoying some tastings, of course.

image.alt: Feast of Saint Augustine Historical Walking Food Tour

item.title: Guided Historical Tour of St. Augustine Per Person
item.description: See St. Augustine's key landmarks—and enjoy a one-of-a-kind, environmentally friendly way to travel—on this small-group electric vehicle tour. Choose from multiple convenient morning and afternoon tour times, meet your guide in the city center, and hop aboard. You'll see St. Augustine landmarks like the Castillo de San Marcos, Tolomato Cemetery, and Mission Nombre de Dios, and will learn all about its centuries of history.

image.alt: Guided Historical Tour of St. Augustine Per Person

item.title: The Original Haunted Pub Tour
item.description: Combine a haunted tour with a pub crawl with this original haunted pub tour in St. Augustine. Follow your guide around to some of downtown St. Augustine’s most infamous and allegedly haunted watering holes, where you can grab drinks (own expense) while learning about the haunted history of the city.

image.alt: The Original Haunted Pub Tour

item.title: Sunset Cruise - #1 Party Boat in St. Augustine, FL
item.description: Sunset is one the most beautiful times of day and many people like to take cruises to see sights from the water when the sun goes down. Kick up the fun with this St. Augustine Sunset Booze Cruise that allows you to see the sights at sunset and enjoy some drinks on the water, too. This cruise has room for up to 24 passengers and takes place in a unique cycle boat.

image.alt: Sunset Cruise - #1 Party Boat in St. Augustine, FL

item.title: : Step back in time with pastime private historical tours
item.description: Discover the historical sites and modern attractions of St. Augustine during this private, guided historical tour. Both the vehicle and driver are decked out in 1920s style, offering you a trip into St. Augustine’s past. Cruise around sites in the historical district such as the Castillo de San Marcos National Monument, Flagler College, the Old City Gates, and St. George Street.

image.alt: : Step back in time with pastime private historical tours

item.title: Wine & Dine Tour (St. Augustine)
item.description: A delicious tour of America’s Oldest City awaits you on this chauffeured food and wine tour through St. Augustine. This auto-adventure whisks you through the streets of St. Augustine’s historic district in an open-air electric vehicle, stopping at some of the guide’s favorite dining venues. Local cuisine paired with tasty wines await your taste buds. As you ride along the streets, pass Flagler College, the Huguenot Cemetery and other historical landmarks.

image.alt: Wine & Dine Tour (St. Augustine)

item.title: Oldest Store Museum Experience in St. Augustine
item.description: From a goat-powered washing machine to bottles of worm syrup, a visit to St. Augustine’s Oldest Store Museum gives visitors a glimpse of everyday 20th century life in St. Augustine—and obscure products, to boot. Costumed guides provide an interactive spin on a history museum as you browse over 100,000 historic products in a recreation of St. Augustine’s original general store.

image.alt: Oldest Store Museum Experience in St. Augustine

item.title: Adventure Boat Tours - Sunset Water Tour in St. Augustine
item.description: St. Augustine is one of the oldest cities in the United States and is a spectacular sight when viewed from the water. Get a glimpse of the city’s historic district and surrounding area during this sunset boat tour. You’ll cruise around the banks of downtown St. Augustine, gazing at sites like the Bridge of Lions and the Castillo de San Marcos National Monument. You’ll also venture into the St. Augustine Inlet and see St. Augustine Lighthouse & Maritime Museum.

image.alt: Adventure Boat Tours - Sunset Water Tour in St. Augustine

item.title: St. Augustine's Sweets & History Walking Tour
item.description: Combine two types of tours of St. Augustine into one tour, and get more from your time. This St. Augustine's Chocolate and Sweets Tour combines chocolate, pralines, and other sweet-food tastings with a rundown of the city's historic district. Pass by the Cathedral Basilica of St. Augustine and the Governor's House Cultural Center and Museum while hearing about the area's past from your guide.

image.alt: St. Augustine's Sweets & History Walking Tour
